title: Transfer Learning-Based EEG Signal Analysis for Imagined Speech Decoding

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Utilization of smartphone-based learning platforms and open-source EEG datasets (FEIS/KaraOne), enabling practical exercises in limited-device environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic principles of electroencephalography (EEG) signals and neural patterns generated during imagined speech.
Learners can implement the design and training process of deep learning models utilizing transfer learning.
Learners can optimize models to achieve over 85% classification accuracy using open-source EEG datasets.

resources: Cloud-Based Deep Learning Environment (e.g., Google Colab)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
